class.name: CoACDSettings
class.brief_description: Settings container for the COACD convex decomposition algorithm.
class.description: This resource stores all configuration parameters used by the COACD convex decomposition system.

members.member: Selects the shape type used for approximating convex parts. The default is standard convex hulls ([constant CONVEX]). Using [constant BOX] produces box-like approximations and may require increasing the concavity threshold (usually around [code]2[/code] times).
Enables decimation by limiting the maximum number of vertices in each convex hull. Must be enabled for [member max_ch_vertex] to apply.
Enables extrusion of neighboring convex hulls along overlapping faces. Controlled by [member extrude_margin].
Extrusion margin distance used when [member extrude] is enabled.
Sets the maximum allowed number of vertices for each convex hull when [member decimate] is enabled.

Maximum number of convex hulls allowed in the result. A value of [code]-1[/code] removes the limit. Only effective when [member merge_postprocessing] is enabled. Limiting the hull count may produce hulls exceeding the concavity threshold.
Number of Monte-Carlo Tree Search iterations used during decomposition. Recommended range: [code]60–2000[/code].
Maximum search depth of the MCTS decomposition tree. Recommended range: [code]2–7[/code].
Maximum number of child nodes in MCTS. Recommended range: [code]10–40[/code].
Enables merge postprocessing, which attempts to combine hulls while respecting the concavity threshold.

Sets the preprocessing mode used for manifold repair. [constant AUTO] automatically decides based on input mesh manifoldness, [constant ON] forces preprocessing, and [constant OFF] disables it entirely.
Resolution used for manifold preprocessing. Recommended range is [code]20–100[/code]. Valid range is [code]5–1000[/code].
Number of samples used to compute Hausdorff distance for concavity measurement. Recommended range: [code]1000–10000[/code].
Concavity threshold controlling when decomposition terminates. Lower values produce more accurate but more numerous hulls. Valid range: [code]0.01–1[/code].

constants.constant: Automatically determines whether preprocessing is needed based on input mesh manifoldness.
Box approximation mode (cube-like hulls). Often requires increasing threshold.
